programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, first aired in June and hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, London Hughes, Rhys James and Milton Jones. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that might be true or might be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are EastEnders star June Brown, comedians Aisling Bea and Seann Walsh, and football presenter Adrian Chiles.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions about literature and language. Stand-up comedian Lloyd Langford joins Bad Education star Jack Whitehall, Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell and regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an edition first broadcast in 2007, Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May celebrate British Leyland's 40th birthday by trying to boost the reputation of the cars that once rolled off its production line. programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Holly Walsh and Cariad Lloyd join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended edition of the comedy panel quiz show, with questions touching on the world's deadliest hunter, a photographer hidden inside an ox, and a juggling otter. As ever, the panellists face fiendishly difficult questions, and points are awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Four famous faces go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games across the week, with comedians Nish Kumar and Al Murray, Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo and broadcaster Anneka Rice the first contestants. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the weekly scores are tallied resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday, when the victor chooses between a House of Games dartboard and a branded dressing gown.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests Dara O Briain, Denise Van Outen, Rhod Gilbert and Vernon Kay, who try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Following a successful pilot scheme trailing the use of body cameras, Staffordshire Police officers are now wearing them on patrol to increase transparency and bring offenders to justice. programme.title: Sin City Motors

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad

programme.title: Sin City Motors

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an episode originally shown in 2011, Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of 2010 Winter Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio travel to Italy to test high-performance hatchbacks. Jeremy Clarkson is in the Citroen DS3 Racing, Richard Hammond champions the Fiat 500C Abarth and James May makes the case for the Renaultsport Clio 200 Cup as they navigate their way round baffling Italian towns and take part in a scavenger hunt, before putting the cars through their paces on the F1 street circuit in Monaco. Also, petrolhead comedian Ross Noble is in the Reasonably Priced Car and the McLaren MP4-12C supercar comes under review.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan, Matt Lucas and Liza Tarbuck join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended edition of the unconventional quiz. This time, the focus falls on the theme 'Odds and Ends'. During the course of the show, the panellists learn how to tell a schnauzerorgan from a paddywhack. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Impossible Railways

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of 1970s-era axe-men, acoustic virtuosos and thumping riff merchants, in a compilation of guitar-heavy performances from the BBC TV archives. Guitar gods including Jimi Hendrix, Pete Townshend, Peter Green and Johnny Winter are joined by, among others, flamenco maestro Manitas De Plata, bottleneck bluesman Ry Cooder and straight-up rockers AC/DC and Thin Lizzy. Plus, Fleetwood Mac, the Jam and Be Bop Deluxe and Nils Lofgren.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: Documentary chronicling a year in the existence of 1,000-year-old Windsor Castle and its inhabitants, from the housekeeper and chefs to the Queen herself, who has allowed her public and private life to be documented more extensively than ever before. The state visit of former President of France Jacques Chirac sees the staff organise a banquet and a performance of a West End musical inside the building - but protesters outside threaten to mar proceedings.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Allied offensive in the Pacific, where America's two-pronged attack led to heavy casualties on both sides, as the Japanese mounted a ferocious defence. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Enola Gay drops the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima in August 1945 as America bids to secure an unconditional surrender from the Japanese, even though conventional bombing raids had already flattened the country. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The award-winning documentary series reveals how the end of the Second World War resulted in Britain's military and economic exhaustion, leaving Europe at the mercy of sparring superpowers as the Cold War era dawned. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Jeremy Isaacs' classic documentary explores the Second World War's powerful legacy. For many people the conflict was the most significant experience of their lives, but it also left millions dead - ordinary civilians and victims of persecution, as well as military casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Murder Maps

programme.desc: Rene learns that the Gestapo are plotting to disguise themselves as British airmen - prompting General Von Klinkerhoffen to adopt a similar plan for Captain Bertorelli's soldiers. Later, the cafe owner and his workers dress up as characters from horror films to fool Herr Flick.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: Historians Ruth Goodman, Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn relive the golden age of steam. They begin by exploring how the introduction of steam railways in the early 19th century created a domestic revolution, from the way people lived to the food they ate. Arriving at Ffestiniog Railway in Snowdonia, they find out how millions of tons of slate were moved down the mountain, while underground, Alex experiences the brutal conditions face by miners in the Llechwedd Quarry.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Forbidden History

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Lost Treasure of the Templars
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates whether the Knights Templar hid their treasure, looted from Jerusalem, on an uninhabited island in Mahone Bay, Nova Scotia.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: Historians Ruth Goodman, Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn continue to relive the golden age of steam and how the Victorian railways created modern Britain. They visit Beamish in County Durham, learning how the rail companies first realised there was money to be made in moving people rather than commodities. Then Peter and Alex live the life of navvies, the men who built the thousands of miles of tracks in all weather conditions, and Ruth finds out what impact the new railroads had on the cottage industries. She also learns about the role of the guard, and the trio learn what precautions were necessary for taking a long journey on a train that was yet to include the necessary facilities.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Rion-Antirion Bridge, which runs for 3kms and links the town of Rio on the Peloponnese peninsula to Antirrio on mainland Greece. Located in one of Europe's most active seismic zones, its engineers had to conquer the problems of deep water, high winds and constant land mass movement to build the colossal structure.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Victoria and Albert's Highland Fling
programme.desc: Tony Robinson visits the Cairngorms National Park to discover how Queen Victoria and Prince Albert helped shape Scottish traditions and imagery, such as tartan, bagpipes and caber-tossing. Starting in Pitlochry, he traverses the Killiecrankie Pass, where the Jacobites won the Battle of Killiecrankie, and ends his trek at Balmoral and the fantasy castle Albert built as his and Victoria's Highland escape.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Portugal to meet leading experts on the Three Secrets of Fatima - a series of visions and prophecies allegedly given by the Virgin Mary to three young shepherds in 1917.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Train Truckers

Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Series exploring ruined engineering projects that have been put to alternative use, including the site of the Chernobyl disaster and a Nazi holiday complex.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: The Two Ronnies

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Rion-Antirion Bridge, which runs for 3kms and links the town of Rio on the Peloponnese peninsula to Antirrio on mainland Greece. Located in one of Europe's most active seismic zones, its engineers had to conquer the problems of deep water, high winds and constant land mass movement to build the colossal structure.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians reveal how the railways transformed the British diet, rescuing a nation that was struggling to feed itself. Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn discover how the mass transportation of livestock gave birth to the traditional British roast, and Ruth Goodman is in Whitby, which became a thriving fishing town thanks to the North Yorkshire Moors Railway supplying its kippers. Plus, Hampshire's watercress line, which brought nutritional salad to the masses, and how the use of steam-powered engines revolutionised production at Britain's oldest brewery.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Norman Conquest of Pembrokeshire
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. With its numerous castles and a fine cathedral, there are sure signs the Normans stamped their mark over the area. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to France to explore the possibility that Jesus married Mary Magdalene, and they had children. He meets respected scholars, authors and historians to consider the theory the son of God's bloodline lives on today.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians take a trip on the Flying Scotsman, arguably the most famous locomotive in the world, along its original route connecting London and Edinburgh - the two most important financial capitals of the Empire. Peter Ginn explores how the railways revolutionised the delivery of mail across Britain, he and Alex Langlands learn about the first electronic communication service - more than 100 years before the arrival of email - and Ruth finds out about the role of the wheeltapper. Plus, why do some railway clocks have more than one minute hand?.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The world's most impressive disused railway bridges, including the biggest wooden trestle bridge in the world, which was closed down due to hurricane damage.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Nazi Occupation - Channel Islands
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Guernsey and Jersey to tell the story of the islands' surrender to the Nazis during the Second World War. In Guernsey, he hears of the first bombing raid that heralded the German troops' arrival and sees the spot where the first-ever British commando landed in secret, only to see the planned revenge raid fail spectacularly. A ferry then takes him on to Jersey, where he finds almost all of its beaches have a bunker or a machine gun post left over from the conflict.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Sardinia to meet the scientists and archaeologists who have evidence that suggests giants once existed. Researchers have discovered abnormally large human skeletons in networks of elaborate caves, mines and tombs in Sardinia, China, the United States, northern India and South America. However, if the race did exist, it remains unclear as to why it has seemingly been eradicated from history.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.desc: Exploring ship graveyards, including Scapa Flow in Orkney, where German warships were scuttled after the First World War, and Mallows Bay, home to 200 wrecks colonised by wildlife.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of tending the fire of a steam locomotive on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she stokes the bolier of NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians explore the life of the South Devon branch line before the Beeching cuts of the 1960s. Peter Ginn joins a footplate crew and receives coal-shovelling tips from a veteran steam engine driver of 63 years' experience, and with Alex he learns about one of Scotland's most lucrative exports. Ruth Goodman finds out about the dangers involved in working on the Victorian railways, and how those who lost limbs were catered for by a dedicated prosthetics workshop. She also discovers how the railways came to the rescue when a deadly disease wiped out almost the entire stock of London cattle.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring ship graveyards, including Scapa Flow in Orkney, where German warships were scuttled after the First World War, and Mallows Bay, home to 200 wrecks colonised by wildlife.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Sardinia to meet the scientists and archaeologists who have evidence that suggests giants once existed. programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: King John's Ruin - Peak District
programme.desc: As the 800th anniversary of the signing of Magna Carta in June 1215 approaches, Tony Robinson sets out to discover the real King John. His walk across the medieval monarch's stamping grounds of Sherwood Forest and the Peak District reveals a hapless man stumbling from crisis to crisis who, in the end, had no choice but to sign away some of his power. In the midst of what are now cultivated fields, Tony finds the scant remains of Laxton Castle, once the control centre where strict 'forest law' was administered and where taxes and fines flooded into the royal coffers. Later, in Sherwood, he explores how the myth of Robin Hood has helped to skew the public's image of King John.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Jerusalem in search of Solomon's Temple. When the Romans sacked the city in 70AD, the fabled Treasure of Solomons was believed to have been looted and taken back to Rome. However, it is possible it was hidden away by the High Priests. Archaeologists Dr Shimon Gibson and Kate Raphael have dedicated their lives working out what actually happened, and discuss whether it is possible that Solomonic and Roman treasures lie undiscovered under Jerusalem.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.desc: A ballet company commissions the sisters to design its costumes, a deal which could lead to both fame and fortune for their fashion house - but Jack is concerned over the amount of time the choreographer is spending with Beatrice. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet, Aden Gillett, Louise Lombard and David de Keyser.

programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The sleuthing 12th-century monk investigates a murder as the Abbey becomes involved in the war between King Stephen and the Empress Maud. The trail of clues leads him to a cache of hidden treasure and the fleeing daughter of the castle's owner, Godith. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer's visiting American cousin flees the UK with the loot from a raid on Wakering Hall. Feature-length Christmas special from 1993, guest starring John Gielgud and Ken Kercheval.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Richard Sharpe becomes a pawn in a French plan to retain control of Spain, and finds himself facing execution for murder. Determined to regain his honour, he undertakes a dangerous quest to find the only person capable of clearing his name. Adaptation of Bernard Cornwell's novel, starring Sean Bean.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Moth
programme.desc: Feature-length version of the drama set at the turn of the 20th century, about the fortunes of a carpenter who moves to the country to start work in his uncle's furniture business, but finds himself forced to seek employment with a beguiling woman known locally as the Moth. Jack Davenport and Justine Waddell star.

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: First in a two-part adaptation of Emily Bronte's classic tale. In 1815, Mr Earnshaw returns home from Liverpool with orphan Heathcliff, who befriends his daughter Cathy but is resented by his son Hindley. Upon his father's death 10 years later, Hindley inherits Wuthering Heights and forces Heathcliff to live in the stables, while Cathy must choose between a life of comfort and her love for Heathcliff. Tom Hardy, Charlotte Riley, Andrew Lincoln and Sarah Lancashire star.

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: Conclusion. Tormented by his love for Cathy, Heathcliff arrives at Thrushcross Grange the day after her wedding to Edgar. Tension mounts as the pair acknowledge their passion for one another, but when she falls pregnant with Edgar's child, Heathcliff leaves Gimmerton to marry Isabella. Tom Hardy, Charlotte Riley, Andrew Lincoln, Rosalind Halstead and Burn Gorman star in Emily Bronte's classic tale.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Detective Inspector Mike Shepherd is sent to the New Zealand town of Brokenwood to investigate the death of a farmer, after his body is found by two local fishermen. As he uncovers a family's tragedies and secrets, he also learns that Brokenwood is a place where shadows lurk just beneath the surface. Drama, starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson.

programme.title: Frankie Drake Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Diamonds Are a Gal's Best Friend
programme.desc: What starts as a simple case of a missing horse leads the team into the gardens of Toronto's elite in pursuit of a murderous jewel thief.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh returns to his Bafta-winning role of the Swedish detective in three adaptations of stories by Henning Mankell. Wallander moves into a new home with his girlfriend, only for their dreams of domestic bliss to be shattered when they discover a skeleton in the garden. He must find the killer if he has any hopes of getting his life settled again - and is surprised to discover the body was buried more recently than he first thought. Saskia Reeves and Sarah Smart co-star.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Barrister James Kavanagh (John Thaw) tries to clear an Oxbridge undergraduate accused of raping a housewife, but his home life begins to interfere with work and the cracks in his marriage to independent and successful wife Lizzie re-emerge. First episode of the legal drama, guest starring Ewan McGregor, with Alison Steadman, Lisa Harrow and Anna Chancellor.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Montford host Jack's film premiere, where Evie meets an attractive Treasury minister. Period drama, starring Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Finlay temporarily hangs up his stethoscope to intervene in a confrontation between Irish farm labourers and irate locals who blame them for a typhus outbreak, and resolves matters with a combination of tough talking and common sense. David Rintoul stars, with Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim's gambling habit looks like it's about to be exposed when he's spotted at a dog track by Steve and Honey, while Terry arrests his own brother on a trumped-up charge, determined to discover whether he's really abusing his sons. Elsewhere, an act of vandalism at a church leads Tony to a wholly unexpected encounter with another of the Radford boys - has this scion of the notorious crime family really become a man of the cloth?.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry is beside himself with worry about his nephews' safety, convinced they are being abused by his brother, and jeopardises the case to help them. Meadows attends the funeral of former colleague Ted Roach, and is drawn into investigating the suspicious circumstances surrounding his death, helped by ex-coppers Bob Cryer and Alec Peters. Questioning his own mortality in the process, he wonders whether a quieter pace of life would suit him better, but soon realises he would miss the thrill of the job and sets off home in a more positive mood - until he gets a shooting pain down his arm.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Neil speedily steps into a convalescing Jack Meadows' shoes, much to the dismay of Debbie McAllister, who takes a dim view of his unseemly haste to take over. Rob organises a disastrous raid on the Radfords' club, while Samantha receives a video of missing daughter Abi, belatedly bringing Phil Hunter round to the view that the youngster has been kidnapped.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina orders Kerry to sever her ties with the Radford family or leave the Met. The Sun Hill sniper claims another victim, raising fears that he's being fed information by a police insider - or may actually work at the station. Behind the scenes, Gabriel gleefully seizes an opportunity to cause renewed friction between Jim and June.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Patricia Routledge stars as Lancashire housewife Hetty Wainthropp, a part-time Post Office worker with a sideline in sleuthing. In this first episode, the mysterious death of a pensioner leaves a few unanswered questions, but Hetty smells a rat and with her young assistant Geoffrey, sets about solving the mystery the police have little interest in. Drama, also starring Dominic Monaghan and David Benfield.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Hetty and amiable sidekick Geoffrey become embroiled in a convoluted case involving a deaf birdwatcher who goes missing at the same time as a woman's body is found at the bottom of a cliff he is known to frequent. Light-hearted drama, with Patricia Routledge and Dominic Monaghan, featuring a guest appearance by David Bower.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The owners of a Tuscan inn are sent a severed finger and a photo of their son. Convinced he has been kidnapped by the Mafia, their daughter hires Hetty while she and Robert are on holiday.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Boxing Day sees heavy snowfall covering the country and the adverse weather causes major disruption across Poplar as roads become blocked and pipes freeze meaning families have to queue outside for water from standpipes. Sister Julienne must inform a family about the death of their loved one and uncovers an uncomfortable truth, while Valerie helps an unmarried couple living in a caravan prepare for their baby, but unforeseen complications knock her confidence in her ability as a midwife. Guest starring Anita Dobson.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie's feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A reluctant Brian enters an addiction centre run by monks to treat his alcoholism, but soon becomes bored and looks for a distraction. He finds one when a chance remark leads the team to reopen an investigation into the death of a heroin user nine years previously - and to help reveal the truth, Gerry is sent undercover as a sex addict. Richard Wilson and Fay Ripley guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Nikki struggles to come to terms with life back home and seeks out fellow pathologist Sally Vaughan for support, only to learn she is nowhere to be found. National Crime Agency investigator Guy Bernhardt asks Nikki to help him by employing pathologist David Cannon, the chief suspect in Sally's disappearance. As Jack, Clarissa and Thomas share concerns about Nikki's wellbeing, a body found in a reservoir is linked to a murder case from 16 years previously. Return of the crime drama, starring Emilia Fox, with Julian Rhind-Tutt and Alex Macqueen.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Boyd is unsettled when Sarah Cavendish (played by Five Daughters star Eva Birthistle), an officer of equal rank to him, joins the team to investigate the disappearance of a banker who had been struggling to cope with losing his daughter to cancer. Though Cavendish's professional skills quickly prove to be a major asset, her new colleagues discover that a failed operation from earlier in her career is continuing to haunt her, and become concerned for her welfare. Trevor Eve stars in the first of a two-part story kicking off the final series of the crime drama, with Sue Johnston and Tara Fitzgerald.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh returns to his Bafta-winning role of the Swedish detective in three adaptations of stories by Henning Mankell. Wallander moves into a new home with his girlfriend, only for their dreams of domestic bliss to be shattered when they discover a skeleton in the garden. He must find the killer if he has any hopes of getting his life settled again - and is surprised to discover the body was buried more recently than he first thought. Saskia Reeves and Sarah Smart co-star.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Winsford Walled Garden in Devon, to answer the owner's horticultural queries.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Joseph makes a shocking discovery, abruptly ending the sisters' excitement about the new clothing deal.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Brad Connor is devastated to learn he may be HIV positive, and makes a drunken pass at Marsha Stubbs. Joy Wilton discovers the joys of mixing work with pleasure.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The scales fall from Kerry's eyes when she sees David Radford kissing someone else, and Samantha fears the worst when a girl's body is washed up near where Abi's clothes were found. Adam considers the appalling prospect that the sniper could be one of the Sun Hill team, while Suzie fuels Andrea's jealousy about her closeness to Neil.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane begins her battle for custody of Jack but just when he's needed more than ever, Owen is nowhere to be found. Carlos persuades a reluctant Tricia to go to the breast care clinic, and Will's wife brings the children to the hospital, announcing that he will have to look after them while she goes to a job interview. Mickie endures a harrowing day as a patient dies after giving birth, and she ends up taking one of Donna's pills, with disastrous repercussions.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A boy sustains serious injuries when a grenade belonging to an old man explodes in an allotment, while another youngster suffers an adverse reaction after consuming deathcap mushrooms. Meanwhile, Kate's daughter Lorna disagrees with her about keeping Trevor alive in a vegetative state.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry exacts revenge on David Radford by sabotaging his planned armed robbery, but Irene turns the tables by producing an incriminating tape. Andrea and Gabriel are both given ultimatums and Adam is furious when information about the Sun Hill sniper is leaked to the newspapers.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ricky has a surprise for Sam which further irritates Frank, while Clyde shocks his father. Arthur gets a gardening contract.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Etta and Celestine are planning a family party, but the younger Traverniers are reluctant to attend. Ian is pleased that Hattie is paying him more attention.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team are called out to help a man with his feet cemented inside a toilet, and the money the Watch raised to pay for a young boy's operation is stolen.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Snooker player Dennis Taylor asks Lovejoy for help finding a billiards table that once belonged to Mary Queen of Scots. Drama, also starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim spars with seductive jewel thief Philippa Vale - but fails to prevent her stealing a priceless diamond in the middle of an auction. John Nettles stars, with Liza Goddard.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Mrs Boswell has trouble with a neighbour, Billy has a new job and Aveline is offered the chance of a lifetime.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mr Goldberg sets up an employment agency and tries to find new jobs for Mrs Slocombe and Mr Humphries. Classic comedy, starring Alfie Bass, Mollie Sugden and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Judith goes away for the weekend, leaving Lionel and Jean with the house to themselves. Comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That with Barry and Glenda?
programme.desc: Truly jumps to the conclusion that Barry is up to no good after he is spotted acting suspiciously, but his real motive for being in the woods with a suitcase is unfathomable. Long-running comedy, staring Mike Grady, Frank Thornton and Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest is stunned when he realises that the fugitive seeking sanctuary at St Mary's is Inspector Sullivan - and the man is wanted for murder. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Tom Chambers and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.sub-title: In the Footsteps of a Killer
programme.desc: Another mystery for the cops on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie, where the sun shines all day and it seems half the residents are killers-in-waiting. However, it's all change for the team. Last week they waved goodbye to Humphrey Goodman. No one knows how Kris Marshall's character is bowing out of the show - will he walk off into the sunset with new love Martha, or will he meet a sticky end, like his predecessor Richard Poole (Ben Miller)? What we do know is that in his place is Ardal O'Hanlon as DI Jack Mooney, who first popped up in the two-part London special. His first Caribbean case sees the reopening of a seven-year-old murder when a tourist provides an alibi for the woman convicted of the crime.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The discovery of a Roman sword with traces of blood on it is linked to an unidentified, headless corpse found near Heathrow in March 2008. It leads the team members to a lock-up belonging to a bodybuilder called Mark Rix, who died of a suspected heart attack the same year, so they start looking for connections between the original murder and Rix's death. They are helped in their investigation by anthropologist Fiona Kennedy, for whom Dan begins to develop feelings - just as he is told his wife might be discharged from the secure hospital where she has spent the past several years. Tracy-Ann Obermann and Liz White guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A wealthy land-owner's wife is strangled to death and her body dumped in a reservoir. Taggart and his partner Livingstone become suspicious when they discover the dead woman's husband was last seen preparing to leave for Switzerland - and carrying a large sum of money. Guest starring Alan Cumming.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sexual tension between Evie and Lord Montford intensifies during a tour of the Palace of Westminster. Drama, starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Winsford Walled Garden in Devon, to answer the owner's horticultural queries.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Legal action against Larry Cotter proves fruitless, so the sisters decide to take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jeremy is forced to face his fear of heights head-on, and Army widow Joy Wilton gets a second chance at happiness, while Michael and Marsha's marriage shows further signs of crumbling. Starring Ben Nealon, Rob Spendlove, Denise Welch and Meera Syal.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry exacts revenge on David Radford by sabotaging his planned armed robbery, but Irene turns the tables by producing an incriminating tape. Andrea and Gabriel are both given ultimatums and Adam is furious when information about the Sun Hill sniper is leaked to the newspapers.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Lisa offers her support to Mickie when she turns up for work with a bruise on her face from being mugged, and Connie upsets Jess with premature news about Zubin moving to the Paris Institute. Tricia discovers the lump in her breast is malignant, and Simon arrives to take baby Jack from Owen and Diane, who throws herself into work to alleviate her distress.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Mike has to talk Josh through an advanced procedure via the telephone, but the patient fails to respond. A baby is brought in overdosed on diazepam and a man attacks the youth who supplied the drugs his late daughter consumed.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Kerry does a disappearing act, leading to speculation that David Radford may have made good on his vow to kill her - although the gangster isn't the only one with a vested interest in ensuring her silence. Smithy eventually discovers the wayward PC by her father's hospital bed and declares his love - but their chances of romance are cut cruelly short when she is struck by a sniper's bullet while returning to Sun Hill station with earth-shattering news.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur becomes the hero of the day. Hattie tries to avoid Ian, while Sharon isn't impressed with the company Grant is keeping. Ricky decides to sell his van to raise money.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant finds out who his friends are. Arthur wants to patch things up with Mark, and Pat has some wise words for Sam and Ricky about their responsibilities.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Malcolm falls for a girl during a fire inspection at a factory, and the team are called in to rescue three people who got stuck in a lift.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A flag from the American War of Independence turns up in a local church and triggers a wave of public interest as a number of villagers come forward to claim it as their own. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim is obliged to arrest a boxer just days before he is due to appear in Jersey's first major professional fight. Drama, starring John Nettles and Tony Osoba.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Mrs Boswell is rushed to hospital after a day out with her friend Derek, Grandad receives a visit from Lilo Lill.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mr Humphries catches a rare and contagious tropical disease - and it is not long before his workmates are getting on each other's nerves even more than usual while quarantined from the outside world. Vintage comedy, starring Mollie Sugden, John Inman and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel becomes depressed that his abilities are dwindling as he ages, while Jean meets his active, outgoing and eccentric father Rocky for the first time - and finds him surprisingly endearing. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly and Alvin take a group of pensioners to a farm for the day, but their act of charity backfires when it becomes clear the elderly daytrippers are not happy with the idea.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: An arsonist terrorises a housing estate, and Hetty goes undercover in a quilt-making circle in her search for the culprit, while Robert is confined at home with a broken collarbone and has to content himself with Polaroid shots of his burgeoning runner bean crop.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The Saint Marie mayoral elections are thrown into disarray when one of the candidates is stabbed to death in the polling booth while casting his vote. Can Irish detective Jack Mooney and his team get to the bottom of this political puzzle? Ardal O'Hanlon stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The arrest of a Turkish girl who has been working illegally leads Ucos to reopen the case of Richard Gibson, a pub landlord who died in a fire in 2009. The original investigation concluded Gibson's death was probably suicide due to his dire financial situation, but the detectives have some questions about the pub's live-in barmaid, who disappeared on the night of the blaze. Could widowed landlady Joanne, pub regular Jason, or the dead man's best friend David, who happens to have a sideline in passing off his British-produced sparkling wine as French champagne, supply them with any answers? While the case tests the team's brain power, Sasha is also keen to raise their fitness levels as she signs them up for a five-a-side football competition. Phil Davis, Niamh Cusack and Tom Georgeson guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detective investigates a failed rape attempt by a masked attacker known as the Bowman. However, his job is complicated when the victim commits suicide and the criminal strikes again. Glasgow-set detective drama, with Mark McManus.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The net starts to tighten around Ralph Saroyan when more is discovered about his secret financial dealings. Meanwhile, Evie's affair with Treasury Minister Lord Montford threatens the future of the company, and Bea's marriage continues to flounder.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Winsford Walled Garden in Devon, to answer the owner's horticultural queries.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: As the wedding day approaches, Evie feels it is time she met her in-laws, but Daniel's response is less than encouraging.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy says farewell to the Fusiliers. Complications during a live firing exercise results in a secret coming up to the surface. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Kerry does a disappearing act, leading to speculation that David Radford may have made good on his vow to kill her - although the gangster isn't the only one with a vested interest in ensuring her silence. Smithy eventually discovers the wayward PC by her father's hospital bed and declares his love - but their chances of romance are cut cruelly short when she is struck by a sniper's bullet while returning to Sun Hill station with earth-shattering news.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jess follows Zubin to Paris, in an attempt to resolve the problems in their relationship once and for all. Her father is also in the city with Donna, in response to a request from a patient who has insisted on seeing a French cancer specialist. However, Ric soon has worries of his own when he gambles all his money away. Back in Britain, Will tries to rush through his shift so he can get home to his children, which proves fatal for a patient.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Kate, Lorna, Andy and Nick gather at Trevor's bedside as his condition worsens. A blood-splattered elderly woman appears in A&E, with no apparent injuries to herself and an inability to discuss the events that have befallen her. A 14-year-old girl is admitted with severe stomach cramps, while Mike finalises plans to return to South Africa.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. After Kerry tragically loses her fight for life, Gabriel sets about covering his tracks by disposing of forensic evidence and intimidating a witness - but a shocking revelation could shatter his cold-blooded demeanour. Stunned by Kerry's death, a grief-crazed Smithy lashes out at Adam, swears revenge on David Radford and hands in his resignation to Gina, while DI Morrell resolves to track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Romance is in the air for Phil when the Mitchells go out on a stag night. Pat gets an urgent call for help. Frank panics about finances, while Pete comes to Sam and Ricky's rescue.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: All Arthur wants is to give Pauline a birthday treat, but his efforts are hampered by a well-meaning family.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Hallam and Tate argue over sending reinforcements in search of missing people after a building collapses. Meanwhile, Charisma learns the truth about Donna.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish dealer tries to beat Charlie Gimbert to a priceless collection of Jewish antiques that has turned up in Essex. Alfred Marks guest stars with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim protects a prestigious Arab visitor staying with Charlie, but is concerned by the number of accidents befalling him. Nadim Sawalha guest stars, with John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The Boswell family try to cope without Nellie, who has some surprise visitors - her 'fancy man' Derek and Lilo Lill.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Captain Peacock's wife is hired as Mr Rumbold's secretary, and he becomes convinced the two are having an adulterous liaison. Comedy, starring Frank Thornton, Nicholas Smith and Diana King.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel becomes suspicious of Alistair's overwhelming desire for his book to be a success. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Barry Becomes a Psychopathic Killer but Only Part-Time
programme.desc: Smiler finds himself pursued by a wanton gold-digger who thinks he's rich, but luckily Truly is full of ideas to solve the problem. Stephen Lewis and Frank Thornton star.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The inspector and his ambitious sergeant John Bacchus investigate the murder of Dolores Kenny, a black woman. She is a regular attender of a local club's soul all-nighters, events popular with factory workers from across the racial divide. Gently begins to uncover evidence of prejudice within the local community and his own police force as he seeks to identify the victim's killer. Detective drama set in 1968, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Lenora Crichlow, Craig Conway, Pippa Bennett-Warner and Maggie O'Neill.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Steve McAndrew brings his dying father to London so he can spend his final days in a nearby hospice, but how much time he can spend with his parent is anyone's guess - the Ucos team is hard at work investigating the cold case murder of 55-year-old interpreter Agnes Bradley. A DNA sample provides a link to a rebellious teenager, and the team wonders if the killer could be related to him. But a whole new can of worms is opened when investigators discover the lad's mother was raped - could the same person have killed Agnes? Gerry and Steve hope that interviewing her friends from a local chess club may shed new light on the matter, but it's a possible professional issue that could hold the key to unlocking the mystery. Denis Lawson and Dennis Waterman star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The discovery of a charred corpse in a disused railway tunnel sets Taggart on the gruesome hunt for a ruthless killer in an investigation with sinister undertones of black magic and voodoo. In an another twist, the wife of an arthritic dentist narrowly escapes a series of murder attempts, adding to a complex case for Taggart and his team. Starring Mark McManus, Blythe Duff and James MacPherson, and featuring a guest appearance by Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. After Kerry tragically loses her fight for life, Gabriel sets about covering his tracks by disposing of forensic evidence and intimidating a witness - but a shocking revelation could shatter his cold-blooded demeanour. Stunned by Kerry's death, a grief-crazed Smithy lashes out at Adam, swears revenge on David Radford and hands in his resignation to Gina, while DI Morrell resolves to track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Ric confesses to Zubin that he has been gambling again, and asks him not to tell Jess - leaving the conflicted anaesthetist more convinced than ever that the relationship can never work and that he should make a fresh start in France. Back in Holby, Rosie tells Mubbs she is considering IVF treatment, while Carlos arranges for Tricia to receive private treatment for her lump - but the condition proves worse than previously thought.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Consultant Jack Hathaway begins his first shift in talkative mood, but soon infuriates Baz by going over her head to perform a risky operation normally only undertaken by neurosurgeons. He responds by telling her he expects her support and will not tolerate anger and bitterness. Elsewhere, Matt loses his temper with an awkward man in reception and Charlie finds himself obliged to report the incident.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Already grief-stricken over Kerry's death, Yvonne faces further trauma as her sister Beverley is roughed up and Shirley reappears in Sun Hill, bringing serious trouble in her wake. Andrea fears her true identity is about to be exposed when her editor is brought in for questioning, while Samantha puzzles over a cryptic message she believes was left by Abi's abductor.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil plans the perfect date, but is his idea of a romantic evening the same as Anne's? Gill gives Mark some advice about Arthur.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil is teased about his new romance and gets a surprise from Anne. Rachel tells Michelle what is worrying her.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Tate suffers a breakdown under the pressures of the job, and Charisma decides that he wants to finish his relationship with Donna.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques expert stumbles on what seems to be a bargain in Frankie's scrap yard in the shape of an iron cannon. Though convinced his luck must finally have changed, problems lie ahead when the item attracts the attention of a devious major. Tongue-in-cheek drama, with Ian McShane and guest star Leslie Phillips.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim is called to investigate an incident at an international rock star's yacht that has left a heavily indebted businessman dead and his wife in a coma. Detective drama set in Jersey, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Nellie, newly released from hospital, meets the family at the Victorian mansion for their holiday - but things aren't exactly relaxing.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Grace Brothers decides to start an in-house magazine with Mr Humphries as the editor, but the new publication causes rifts among members of the staff. Vintage comedy, starring John Inman, Mollie Sugden and Wendy Richard.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: A chance encounter leads to an invitation for Jean to stay at her sister-in-law's home, but she has to persuade Lionel to accompany her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Things to Do When Your Wife Runs Off with a Turkish Waiter
programme.desc: Barry and Glenda get a shock when a man they foolishly exchanged addresses with on holiday turns up on their doorstep. To make a strained situation worse, it appears their guest has an unusual hobby.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: Ellen Mallam is left to drown in an upturned car by its driver, but the young woman's connection to James Blackstone, an aristocratic family's heir apparent, impedes Gently and Bacchus's investigation. The chief inspector discovers that the son's future has been carefully mapped out since birth by his implacable mother Alethea, and she will not countenance any interference in her plans. However, an astonishing twist causes the detectives to reconsider the case in its entirety. Sixties-set detective drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Geraldine Somerville, James Norton, Roger Lloyd Pack, Christopher Fairbank and Ebony Buckle.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: An elderly amateur sleuth who was a friend of Danny's is murdered, and he ends up embroiled in the case when his photo is found at the scene. However, the cold case copper becomes convinced that the secret to uncovering her real killer lies within the last case she was working on. Picking up where she left off, he travels to the village of Minchampton, where a woman was said to have been murdered by a local lad 25 years previously. Meanwhile, Sasha is left to cope with the investigating officer on the modern-day Miss Marple's murder - an overbearing contemporary from her Hendon training, by the name of DCI Grace Mackie - and Steve lets Gerry stay with him when he is evicted, but soon comes to regret the act of kindness.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A woman shoots her unfaithful husband and it appears to be an open-and-shut case - until the team discovers the man was already dead. Mark McManus stars.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Evie's affair with the treasury minister hits the papers, while the shop is hit badly by the opening of Maison Gilles in London. Jack is attracted to the star of his latest film.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters are faced with the prospect of either selling up or accepting money from Lord Montford and Jack Maddox - an option neither is keen to contemplate.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Drama set in 1895, chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. The first episode sees Eleanor embarking on her medical career _ and immediately crossing swords with eminent surgeon Sir Herbert Hamilton. Jemma Redgrave stars in the title role, with David Calder as her father, and Robert Hardy as Sir Herbert.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Colette is overjoyed to learn that the Fusiliers will shortly be leaving for South Africa, and tries to persuade Joe that it would be the ideal place to get married. Marsha learns that Michael has been having an affair and resolves to fight for him, no matter what it takes.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Already grief-stricken over Kerry's death, Yvonne faces further trauma as her sister Beverley is roughed up and Shirley reappears in Sun Hill, bringing serious trouble in her wake. Andrea fears her true identity is about to be exposed when her editor is brought in for questioning, while Samantha puzzles over a cryptic message she believes was left by Abi's abductor.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Complications arise during Tricia's mastectomy and she is rushed to Holby, to the surprise of Chrissie, who also discovers Carlos plans to leave. Mickie is reunited with her mother and Owen suggests to Diane that they have a baby together. Will continues torturing himself over the death of a patient, and decides to quit - but Connie refuses to accept his resignation.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A pregnant woman is attacked by a dog, placing the unborn child's life in danger. A groom collapses at the altar with an epileptic fit, while Gloria deals with an infected pierced belly button and later accepts an offer of a drink from Richard.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Yvonne is horrified to learn Beverley was assaulted by her own husband and promptly alerts CID, only for the case to take an unexpected twist when the culprit insists he acted in self-defence. Jim puts his marriage on the line by succumbing to his gambling addiction yet again, despite a stern lecture from June and threats from an angry loan shark. Jack returns to Sun Hill, determined to reassert his status as top cop, but his colleagues doubt whether he has fully recovered from his heart attack.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat plays surrogate mother to Mandy. Will Frank play the father role?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark makes a decision about his future which proves unpopular with Pauline. Could Gill be the one to change his mind? Sam and Ricky are in for a shock at the squat.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: While hosting an opening day for the local children, the team are held hostage in the station by a gang of armed criminals. Starring Mark Arden and Sean Blowers.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Ram-raiders destroy a valuable Sheraton desk and steal what they haven't broken, forcing the roguish dealer to scout around for new stock. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim attempts to investigate a robbery, but finds it tough going with only the slenderest of leads to follow. Detective drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Connie and Oswald join the holiday to see Billy and Aveline, and Joey's protest about the game shooting on the estate wins him an admirer.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The employees are insulted by a suggestion that they take a wage cut, and decide to hold a rooftop demonstration. Comedy, starring Mollie Sugden and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel asks Jean to accompany him on an all-expenses-paid cruise, but she remains unmoved by his efforts to woo her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Beware of Laughing at Nora's Hats
programme.desc: Alvin tries to persuade Nora Batty to go for a ride in his sidecar, but she's having none of it. When she relates the story of her long-standing feud with Audrey Craig - who had the audacity to laugh at her hat during a wedding many years ago - it becomes clear the broom-brandishing battleaxe is not one to be messed with.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A middle-class couple's adopted child is kidnapped, a case that takes Gently and Bacchus to a home where unmarried mothers are forced to give up their babies. Suspicion initially falls upon the natural mother, who is thought to have 'stolen' her baby back. But further investigations reveal a much darker side to the adoption home itself and raise questions as to how far this seemingly perfect couple were prepared to go to become parents. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Mark Gatiss, Helen Baxendale and Alison Steadman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Back in 1983, 16-year-old Amy Taskerland was murdered on the night of the school disco. More than 30 years later, the unearthing of a time capsule and the discovery of her voice on a mix tape inside prompts Miller and co to delve back into the case, starting by interviewing Amy's best friend Harriet and her former teacher Mr Hines. The recording features a strange mix of music and poetry, including words from a speech written in secret for the Queen for broadcast in the event of a nuclear war. But how did Amy get a copy of it, and was its secret nature the reason she was killed? Elsewhere, Miller enjoys her first romance since her divorce, while Gerry goes on his future son-in-law's stag night. Amy Nuttall (Emmerdale, Downton Abbey) and Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe) guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A young boy falls into a creek and drowns, while his mother is found slumped in the hallway. Dr Stephen Andrews discovers both ingested rat poison, and suspicion falls on the grieving husband and father. The detective soon uncovers a sordid case of extortion and forgery as part of his investigation. Crime drama, starring Mark McManus.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters launch their spring collection for working women to much acclaim, which leads to Beatrice and Evie receiving an offer that has both business and personal consequences. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Connie and Oswald join the holiday to see Billy and Aveline, and Joey's protest about the game shooting on the estate wins him an admirer.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.
